requirements.summary: Implement single-page envelope-to-letter reveal interaction (click/tap) without routing or reloads.
acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the envelope is visible and the letter is not visible.
Clicking/tapping the envelope hides the envelope and shows the letter without a page reload.
The interaction works with both mouse and touch input.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page Valentine Letter view with local UI state controlling envelope visibility vs. letter visibility; ensure the envelope control is accessible (keyboard focusable) and uses click/tap friendly handlers (React onClick).
Verify the app renders the new single-page App component as the only experience (no routing added) and that the envelope-to-letter state change occurs without navigation.

requirements.summary: Render the provided letter text exactly (line-by-line paragraphs) inside a readable, card-styled layout.
acceptanceCriteria: All paragraphs appear in the same order as the provided HTML.
The letter container is visually distinct from the page background (card styling with padding and rounded corners).
Text is readable on both mobile and desktop (no horizontal overflow).

file_operations.description: Add the letter content as explicit paragraph elements in the exact provided order and wording; wrap content in a white card container with responsive max width and spacing to avoid horizontal overflow.

requirements.summary: Use Tailwind CSS styling to approximate the original centered layout, soft pink background, and card shadows/rounded corners for envelope and letter.
acceptanceCriteria: The page background is a light pink tone.
The envelope element appears as a centered clickable card with rounded corners and a shadow.
The letter card has a white background, rounded corners, and a shadow similar to the envelope.

file_operations.description: Apply Tailwind utility classes for centered layout, light pink page background, envelope card styling (rounded corners + subtle shadow), and letter card styling (white background + rounded corners + shadow).

Optionally extend Tailwind theme tokens (e.g., custom rose/pink background/shadow values) to better match the provided CSS colors (#ffe6e6, #f77) while keeping the styling consistent and reusable across the page.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive Valentine-themed visual system (typography, spacing, palette, and micro-interactions) consistently without adding new features.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI uses a consistent color palette and typography (not default browser styling).
Interactive states are present (e.g., hover/active/focus styling on the envelope element).
The theme does not rely on blue/purple as primary colors.

file_operations.description: Create global styles for a cohesive theme (font smoothing, base typography, and consistent background/foreground defaults) that complement Tailwind; ensure the overall palette is rose/pink/neutral and avoids blue/purple primaries.
Add Valentine-appropriate micro-interactions using Tailwind states (hover/active/focus-visible), consistent spacing/typography choices, and a cohesive palette across envelope and letter elements.

Adjust document-level presentation if needed for the theme (e.g., ensure the title remains 'Valentine Letter' and optionally include a non-blue/purple typography choice) while keeping the experience single-page.
